edu.sjsu.cs.ghost151

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.sjsu.cs.ghost151.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class represents the environment for the simulation. It provides operations for getting and setting the objects at a particular BoardPosition.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int COLUMNS 
      int ROWS 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Constructs and Initializes a 10x20 board
      Board(int numberOfRows, int numberOfColumns)
      Constructs and Initializes the Board with the specified number of rows and columns.

      void Initialize()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructs and Initializes a 10x20 board

      • Board

        public Board(int numberOfRows,
     int numberOfColumns)
        Constructs and Initializes the Board with the specified number of rows and columns. The smallest number of rows or columns is 2 (the Board would consist entirely of Walls)

    • Method Detail

      • Initialize

        public void Initialize()
        Places Wall BoardObjects at the edges of the board and Empty BoardObjects everywhere within the interior

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Renders the board as an ASCII diagram: (Here, there are two Ghosts and one Target on the board). 
         ++++++++++++++++++++
 +                  +
 +         &        +
 +                  +
 +           &      +
 +                  +
 +                  +
 +  @               +
 +                  +
 ++++++++++++++++++++
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • IsValidMoveTarget

        public boolean IsValidMoveTarget(BoardPosition position)
        Determine if the BoardObject at the given BoardPosition can be "moved on" (by a ghost, for example)
        Parameters:
        position - The BoardPosition to check
        Returns:
        true if the BoardObjectType at that position is Empty or Target

      • SetObjectAt

        public void SetObjectAt(BoardPosition boardPosition,
               BoardObject boardObject)
        Takes any object and assigns it to a position on the Board.
        Parameters:
        boardPosition - the position to set the object at
        boardObject - the object to place

      • GetObjectAt

        public BoardObject GetObjectAt(BoardPosition boardPosition)
        get the object at a given Board position.
        Parameters:
        boardPosition - the board position to get object from
        Returns:
        the object at that position or null if position is out of range

      • BoardPosition

        public BoardPosition BoardPosition(int row,
                          int column)
        Creates a new BoardPosition for this board
        Parameters:
        row - the row for the new position
        column - the column for the new position
        Returns:
        a new BoardPosition for this board

      • getGrid

        public BoardObject[][] getGrid()
        Get the grid object.
        Returns:
        the grid

      • getRenderer

        public BoardRenderer getRenderer()
        Returns:
        the renderer this Board is using

      • setRenderer

        public void setRenderer(BoardRenderer renderer)
        Parameters:
        renderer - the renderer this Board should use
